byline.contributor: Andrew E. Kramer reported from Artemivsk, and Michael R. Gordon from Washington. David M. Herszenhorn contributed reporting from Moscow.
byline.original: By ANDREW E. KRAMER and MICHAEL R. GORDON

abstract: United States accuses Russia of participating in separatist rebel assault on Ukrainian forces around town of Debaltseve in eastern Ukraine; comes as fighting flares in region ahead of negotiated cease-fire; ramped-up violence underscores concerns that cease-fire will be as fleeting as earlier pacts; Russia denies involvement.
lead_paragraph: The accusation from the State Department said the Russian military had massed artillery and rocket systems near a contested town in eastern Ukraine.

headline.main: U.S. Faults Russia as Combat Spikes in East Ukraine
headline.print_headline: U.S. Faults Russia as Combat Spikes in East Ukraine

snippet: The accusation from the State Department said the Russian military had massed artillery and rocket systems near a contested town in eastern Ukraine.
